es.ull.iis.simulation.sequential.flow
Class MergeFlow

java.lang.Object
  es.ull.iis.simulation.sequential.SimulationObject
      es.ull.iis.simulation.sequential.flow.BasicFlow
          es.ull.iis.simulation.sequential.flow.SingleSuccessorFlow
              es.ull.iis.simulation.sequential.flow.MergeFlow
All Implemented Interfaces:
FinalizerFlow, Flow, JoinFlow, MergeFlow, SingleSuccessorFlow, Identifiable, SimulationObject, java.lang.Comparable<SimulationObject>
Direct Known Subclasses:
ANDJoinFlow, ORJoinFlow
public abstract class MergeFlow
extends SingleSuccessorFlow
implements MergeFlow, JoinFlow

A flow which merges several incoming branches into a single outgoing branch. The incoming branches are handled in an internal structure and managed per element.

When an incoming branch arrives, the arrive is invoked. Both, true and false work threads are computed. Then, the flow checks (depending on the implementation) if this branch canPass or not. If it can pass, the outgoing flow is activated. Next, the flow checks if the branch canReset the structure, if so, it's reset. Only true work threads can pass, but both true and false threads can reset the structure. In case the structure has to be reset and it has not been activated, a new false work thread continues the execution.

Author:
ycallero

canPass

protected abstract boolean canPass(WorkThread wThread)
Checks if the last incoming branch can pass.

Parameters:
wThread - The thread of control of the incoming branch
Returns:
True if the incoming branch activates the outgoing branch; false in other case.

canReset

protected boolean canReset(WorkThread wThread)
Checks if the last incoming branch can reset the control structure. The structure has to be reset when all the incoming branches has been activated once.

Parameters:
wThread - The thread of control of the incoming branch
Returns:
True if all the incoming branches were activated once; false in other case.

reset

protected void reset(WorkThread wThread)
Resets the control structure, so the next incoming branch for the same element will use a new control structure.

Parameters:
wThread - The thread of control of the incoming branch
